title: Post-Technician-change full tier sweep and validation
description:
After BL-031 (Technician MOM 61→64) and BL-033 (test fixes) are complete, run a full simulation sweep to validate the change.

Run simulations at: bare, uncommon, rare, epic, giga (all 5 key tiers).
Also run uncommon aggressive, uncommon defensive for variant check.

Verify:
1. Technician win rate improved +2-3pp across tiers (target ≥47% bare, ≥48% giga)
2. No new dominance flags (no archetype >57% at any tier)
3. No new weakness flags (no archetype <40% at any tier)
4. Spread at each tier not worse than previous session
5. Charger and Bulwark win rates not significantly changed

DEPENDS ON: BL-031, BL-033 (tests must be passing first).

Acceptance criteria: Full sweep documented in analysis/balance-tuner-round-1.md. All flags resolved or accepted.

title: Evaluate gear variant impact on player decisions
description:
Analyze whether the 3 gear variants (aggressive/balanced/defensive) create meaningful player choices:

1. Does variant choice feel impactful or like noise? Can a player FEEL the difference between all-aggressive and all-defensive loadouts?
2. Are there interesting variant combinations? (e.g., aggressive lance + defensive armor for a specific matchup strategy)
3. Is the UI clear enough for players to understand what each variant does?
4. Should variant choice interact with archetype selection? (e.g., aggressive gear on a Bulwark — is that a fun contrarian build or just suboptimal?)
5. Propose any improvements to make variant selection more engaging.

Read src/engine/gigling-gear.ts, src/engine/player-gear.ts, and the gear variant test data. Write analysis to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-2.md.

Acceptance criteria: Clear assessment of variant system with at least 1 concrete improvement proposal.

title: New player experience — first-match clarity audit
description:
Imagine a player who has NEVER played this game opening it for the first time. Walk through their experience:

1. Setup screen: Do they understand what archetypes mean? Are stat labels (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA) clear?
2. Loadout screen: Is gear/rarity/variant selection overwhelming? What could be simplified for first-timers?
3. Speed selection: Do they understand the speed/power tradeoff?
4. Attack selection: Can they learn the counter system? Are hints sufficient?
5. Pass results: Can they understand what happened and WHY they won/lost?
6. Melee phase: Is the transition clear? Do they understand the new attack set?

Propose improvements focused on CLARITY, not dumbing down. Write analysis to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-3.md.

Acceptance criteria: Walkthrough of first-match experience with at least 3 clarity improvement proposals ranked by impact.

title: Add ARIA attributes and semantic markup for accessibility
description:
Multiple components lack proper accessibility attributes:

1. Combat log toggles and AI thinking panel toggles: add aria-expanded, aria-controls
2. Summary tables: add scope='col' to <th> elements
3. Rarity grid cards: add role='button' or use <button> with aria-label
4. Match timeline pips: add aria-label describing pass results
5. Clickable elements that aren't <button>: add role='button' tabIndex={0} and keyboard event handlers

Focus on SetupScreen.tsx, LoadoutScreen.tsx, MatchSummary.tsx.

Acceptance criteria: All interactive elements are keyboard-navigable. Screen reader can describe game state. All tests passing.

title: Add hover/focus states for interactive card elements
description:
Interactive cards (.card--selectable, .attack-card, .speed-card) need better hover/focus polish:

1. .attack-card, .speed-card: add :hover with subtle brightness/shadow enhancement
2. All selectable cards: add :focus-visible with 2px gold outline offset for keyboard nav
3. All selectable cards: add :active pressed effect (scale 0.98, slight shadow reduction)
4. Variant toggle buttons: enhance box-shadow on active state instead of just border
5. Ensure WCAG AA color contrast on all hover states

Acceptance criteria: All interactive elements have distinct hover, focus, and active states. Keyboard navigation is visually clear.

title: Polish animations, transitions, and visual hierarchy
description:
Improve visual polish in several areas:

1. Add cascading delays to multi-element entrance sequences (timeline pips, gear lists)
2. Summary table rows: add subtle :hover background highlight
3. Combat log entries: add visual separation (border-left accent per entry)
4. Increase line-height in dense text blocks (pass result breakdown, stat comparisons)
5. Reduce animation durations on mobile (@media max-width: 480px) for performance
6. Verify all animations respect prefers-reduced-motion

Acceptance criteria: Smoother animations, better readability in dense areas, mobile performance improved.

title: Add phase-resolution edge case tests
description:
The phase-resolution test suite (38 tests) needs expansion for edge cases:

1. Test unseat on pass 1 (earliest possible) — verify melee transition is correct
2. Test unseat on pass 5 (last pass) — verify carryover/melee handling
3. Test both players unseated in same pass — verify tiebreaker logic
4. Test extreme fatigue scenarios (stamina=0 or stamina=1) — verify guard fatigue floor
5. Test shift eligibility at exact threshold (CTL == shiftThreshold, stamina == 10)
6. Test Breaker guard penetration interacting with high-guard defender in melee

Acceptance criteria: ≥12 new tests covering edge cases. All passing. No engine changes.

title: Add integration tests for full match with gear loadouts
description:

1. Full match with uncommon steed + player gear: verify stat pipeline (base → steed → player → softCap)
2. Full match with giga gear: verify softCap activates on high stats
3. Full match with mixed variants: aggressive steed + defensive player gear
4. Full match comparing bare vs giga outcomes: giga should produce higher impact scores
5. Verify createMatch() works with all 6 argument combinations (0/2/4/6 loadout args)
6. Test that applyPlayerLoadout does NOT add rarity bonus (regression guard)

Acceptance criteria: ≥10 new integration tests. All passing. No engine changes.
